verses.kjv: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
verses.ct: Where has your love gone, most beautiful of women? Which direction did he go? We'll help you look for him.

verses.kjv: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
verses.ct: My love has gone down to his garden, to the beds of spices, to enjoy the gardens and pick lilies.

verses.kjv: I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.
verses.ct: I belong to my love, and my love belongs to me — he who enjoys himself among the lilies.

verses.kjv: Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.
verses.ct: You are as beautiful as Tirzah, my darling, as lovely as Jerusalem, as awe-inspiring as an army marching with banners.

verses.kjv: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
verses.ct: Look away from me — your eyes overwhelm me! Your hair flows like a flock of goats streaming down from Gilead.

verses.kjv: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.
verses.ct: Your teeth are like a flock of sheep coming up from being washed — each one has its match, and not a single one is missing.

verses.kjv: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.
verses.ct: Your cheeks behind your veil are like the halves of a pomegranate.

verses.kjv: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.
verses.ct: There may be 60 queens, 80 secondary wives, and young women too many to count.

verses.kjv: My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
verses.ct: But my dove, my perfect one, is unique. She is her mother's only daughter, the favorite of the woman who gave her life. When other young women saw her, they called her blessed. Queens and secondary wives praised her too.

verses.kjv: Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?
verses.ct: Who is this woman who appears like the dawn, as stunning as the moon, as radiant as the sun, as awe-inspiring as an army marching with banners?

verses.kjv: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.
verses.ct: I went down to the grove of nut trees to see the new growth in the valley, to check whether the vines had sprouted and the pomegranates were blooming.

verses.kjv: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.
verses.ct: Before I even realized it, my desire swept me away like the chariots of Amminadib.

verses.kjv: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
verses.ct: Come back, come back, Shulamite! Come back, come back so we can gaze at you! Why would you stare at the Shulamite? She dances as though between 2 armies.
